data.text:
@EnemyInAState Not kinda, not sorta... this is PRECISELY what I described. 

But I beat them to it by a few weeks

@EnemyInAState I explained this exactly in my article...

Other than different variants in different organs, I said it slightly different

I have different combos of cells that create immune escape& can develop into new variants in our body

I mean, this is precisely what I said was happening
@EnemyInAState @Harvard2H would say this is not new or groundbreaking; it’s been known for years and why his predictions are so dire. We are unbelievably fucked
@EnemyInAState I've read some interesting research comparing it to ME in terms of long covid symptoms
@EnemyInAState Not sure why people in 2022 are still surprised by the virus’s anatomical distribution.  https://t.co/uXjMtaJQcw
The findings provide yet more evidence that the virus is not simply 'cleared' in many people after a few weeks, but is capable of persisting for much longer—a consistent finding at this point.

obviously, if the virus is unable to be detected in the immune system, then an immune response is unlikely to be mounted—the research team hope that these findings will lead to better anti-viral treatments: https://t.co/5E17N3MkgP
